comments.commentBody: Exactly when did the UN take property from Palestinian Arabs?    The British Mandate took over from the Ottomans.    The Arabs had no more claim to the land than the Jews.

Pretty funny - The party that claims to support capitalism all the way - to full class demarcations decry that that capitalism sent jobs (outsourcing) to areas of lower labor but considered adequate quality to those capitalistic corporations.

And yes, I do find this racially insensitive. Having endured inummerable "prank" calls as a child and worse for having a non WASP surname, one clearly Chinese, and having been physically bullied for the same, I'd say this commerical is doing exactly the same thing.

So the Republicans are really all about isolationism and jingoism - in this global marketplace.

Though I deplore Hoekstra's ideas and his willingness to bend the truth, the fact is that the Netherlands is a multi-ethnic, many-colored society with full legal attention turned on racial and ethnic slurs, discrimination, and stereotyping.  It's hard to convince many Americans that Europeans have the same (maybe more) freedoms and civil engagement as we in the U.S.

Unfortunately, in America we do tolerate openly stereotyping, discrimination and racism - at least, some of us do, as witnessed by the loud applause at some of the punchlines during the Republican reality shows (oh, I mean "debates").

It isn't fair to blame the TV station for broadcasting this ad. Under the law, TV stations are required to sell time to candidates for federal office no matter how offensive the ad may be. Furthermore, they must charge the lowest available rate. For noncandidate ads, however, they are permitted to use their judgment.

Here in southern Illinois, we got a Randall Terry for President ad, complete with pictures of aborted fetuses, immediately following the Super Bowl on the local NBC affiliate that had broadcast the game. It's not just the candidates and their campaign strategies; it's also the questionable judgment of TV executives (in this case, in Paducah, Kentucky) who sell commercial time to the highest bidder. But, not to all bidders, especially if they espouse a progressive agenda.

Whoa! Hoekstra may be a fool, a bigot and, maybe worse, a Republican, but that is no reason to defame the Netherlands.

Despite all the oversimplified pap you have been fed and apparently desperately want to believe, in all possible ways the Dutch make this country by comparison to appear to be third world. They have robust social liberalism coupled with permissive individuality, a true social and modernized high tech infrastructure (including single payer nationalized health care and excellent public transportation) plus, yes, a very vibrant, modern and relatively healthy, mostly capitalist economy.

Also, despite the headlines, they have mostly integrated their former colonial citizens and most others of non-European origin into Dutch society (which, as a long historical matter since the middle ages, is highly multi-cultural - 70% of the Dutch speak near fluent English and at least one other language besides Dutch) far better than we have dealt recently with our minorities and immigrants.

I am not Dutch in any way, and they are far from perfect, but I can personally vouch that your statement was absurd and ignorant.

Insult the GOP if you must, but not the Netherlands.
The subject of the bad was not in politics when it was decided to allow 10s of trillions in jobs and capital to be exported tax-free overseas.
Yes it is. But, he knows his audience.
Definitely in the "sun is hot, water is wet" category.
I guess I'm not super surprised that a GOP candidate is completely tone-deaf to racial/ethnic sensitivity issues.

Racism is the fall back position of the left.  Remember the Willie Horton ad?  A rapist got parol after a short sentence but the ad was race baiting. Sure. Women were afraid of the guy's black skin not the fact he was a convicted rapist. I don't won't Obamacare and the higher taxes it will bring. Or I disagree with much of his foreign policy. That makes me a racist. The Debbiespenditnow ad is  a non story but the NYT tries to create one from it. Remember this is the same media that called Rodney King (a convict and parole violator) a "motorist." Guess Lee Harvey Osward was just a "marksman."

Democrats are called "tax and spend" by their enemies, but that is what every government on the planet does with the taxes, they spend it, they don't hide it in holes in the ground.

Republicans are "borrow and spend". They like to lower taxes because its popular and people see something of it every year, but our ability to pay for things like education and funding our military takes a huge hit. They borrow to cover the immediate difference, and as soon as a Democrat takes office they blame the "tax and spend" Democrats, and pledge fiscal restraint.

I can only hope we as a country are able to move pass the smoke and mirrors the Republicans play and expose them for being the bully that is blaming the nerd for what the bully does.
This is a pathetic  and ignorant advertisement.
Still voting democrat.
Racist/racially insensitive politicians don't surprise me anymore.  However, the actress who sold out was more of a surprise.  She should be ashamed.

If Pete Hoekstra were to say he didn't believe the ad had racist overtones when he approved it, I might have believed him. He could be so focused on his message, Mr. Hoekstra might have missed the racist overtones. But, his staff shouldn't have.

Typical Republican arrogance; I believe this so how could you see it different? There are so many dog-whistles in this ad, you might as well be using an airhorn. The Pete I know would be this arrogant and believe he has done nothing to insult anyone. He wouldn't even consider the possibility.

There are many good people in west Michigan who are insulted by this ad. It doesn't address the issues and just insults a lot of people in the process.

Pete never was the sharpest tool in the shed.

I'm shocked - shocked! - to hear that Republicans are putting out racially insensitive advertisements. I can't believe they would stoop so low as to appeal to racist tendencies of white voters. Just to get elected! Republicans! What's gotten into them the past 40 years?
Everybody has said just about everything about this dumb ad.  Now, Inquiring Minds want to know who the actress was and what she was told about her gig.  Poor girl!

The Dutch would, most of them, laugh at the commercial you suggest.
Dutch racism? Let me remind you that the Dutch hid their Jewish friends and neighbors during the occupation, even though it imperiled their own lives, whereas other countries simply turned their Jews over. The Dutch are pretty tolerant and treat people well, for the most part. Their approach to sex and marijuana seems practical.
Aren't you stereotyping the Dutch?  Just sayin'.

Well Mike people have the choice whether or not to donate to Pete's campaign. People don't have a choice whether or not to pay taxes. By the way not critics of the ad have found anything false with it. Non native English speakers often speak with accents. We are borrowing tons of money from China. The business climate is far favorable in China. Go Democrats facts don't work charge "racism."
He not only LOOKS dumb - he should remain just what he all ready is, a former congressman.

20% of the population in the Netherlands come from other countries. 70% of the population is bilingual.

They are one of the most tolerant societies in the world.

Know whereof you speak before you spout off.
And because we want stuff at the cheapest price.
Hoekstra moved to the U.S. when he was three years old.  Guess he learned his intolerance here.
